oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bedeutung selbst begrünter Brachstreifen für die Segetalflora von Sandäckern im Ökologischen Landbau
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Sommer, Tabea
Neumann, Helge
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Biodiversity and ecosystem services
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In a one-year study in Northern Germany, we analyzed the effects of unsown fallow strips and landscape heterogeneity on the segetal flora of organically managed sandy fields. Diversity of plants was higher in two/three-year-old fallow strips compared to reference sites tilled with winter rye. Concerning endangered species, this effect was more pronounced in fields that were in a small-scale than in a homogenous landscape, as the latter possibly featured less colonization potential.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Sommer, Tabea and Neumann, Helge (2013) Bedeutung selbst begrünter Brachstreifen für die Segetalflora von Sandäckern im Ökologischen Landbau. Poster at: 12. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Rheinische Friedrich-Wilhelms-Universität, Bonn, 5. bis 8. März 2013.
